verses.text: 稱頌 神拯救脫離死亡 （大衛的詩：獻殿之歌。）耶和華啊！我要尊崇你，因為你曾救拔我，不容我的仇敵向我誇耀。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts to describe praise to God.
In many Chinese Bibles, a leading space (　) is used before 神 as a mark of reverence.
A title referring to a psalm sung at the dedication of the temple.
Emphasizes pulling someone out of a difficult situation.

verses.text: 耶和華我的 神啊！我曾向你呼求，你也醫治了我。

words.note: In many Chinese Bibles, a leading space (　) is used before 神 as a mark of reverence.

verses.text: 耶和華啊！你曾把我從陰間救上來，使我存活，不至於下坑。

words.note: Refers to the realm of the dead in Hebrew thought.
Figurative for dying or going into the grave/Sheol.

verses.text: 耶和華的聖民哪！你們要歌頌耶和華，讚美他的聖名。
因為他的怒氣只是短暫的，他的恩惠卻是一生一世的；夜間雖然不斷有哭泣，早晨卻必歡呼。

words.note: An idiom emphasizing the entirety of a person's existence or duration.

verses.text: 至於我，我在安穩的時候曾說：「我必永不動搖。」
耶和華啊！你的恩寵，使我堅立，如同大山；你一掩面，我就驚惶。

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew YHWH.
Describes divine favor or grace.
Often used with 就 (jiù) to mean 'as soon as... then...'
Figuratively, God hiding his face means withdrawing favor.

verses.text: 耶和華啊！我曾向你呼求；我曾向我主懇求，說：
「我被害流血，下到深坑，有甚麼益處呢？塵土還能稱讚你，還能傳揚你的信實嗎？

words.note: Often used metaphorically for humans or the dead in biblical contexts.
A key attribute of God in the Bible.

verses.text: 耶和華啊！求你垂聽，恩待我；耶和華啊！求你幫助我。」

words.note: Implies a humble and attentive listening, especially from a superior.

verses.text: 你已經把我的悲哀變為舞蹈，把我的麻衣脫去，又給我穿上歡樂；

words.note: Indicates the object of a verb is placed before it.
Indicates the object of a verb is placed before it.
Garment made of coarse cloth, symbolizing mourning or repentance.
Here indicating a benefit, 'for me'.

verses.text: 好讓我的靈歌頌你，永不停止。耶和華我的 神啊！我要永遠稱讚你。

words.note: Refers to the inner being or soul; also translated as 'glory' or 'liver' in some contexts.
To sing a hymn of praise or worship.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
